source_translation: to rise and fall irregularly in number or amount
example: The unemployment rate fluctuated between 4% and 5% throughout the decade.

target_translation: chạm mức bình ổn / không thay đổi sau khi tăng
source_translation: to reach a state of little or no change after a period of activity or progress
example: Sales increased rapidly in the first quarter but plateaued at $50,000 in June.

target_translation: theo cấp số nhân / cực nhanh
source_translation: in a manner that becomes quicker and quicker as the number or amount increases
example: The number of internet users grew exponentially between 1995 and 2005.

source_translation: to show or represent by a drawing, chart, or other art form
example: The line graph depicts the changes in energy consumption over a 20-year period.

source_translation: separately or individually and in the order already mentioned
example: The figures for wheat and corn production were 20 and 35 tonnes respectively.

source_translation: to become greater than in number or amount
example: By 2010, the amount of energy from solar power surpassed that of wind power.

source_translation: to supply or make up a specified amount or proportion
example: In 2020, renewable energy sources accounted for 25% of total power generation.

source_translation: so small or unimportant that it is not worth considering
example: The difference in oil prices between the two countries was negligible.

source_translation: an increase that makes a quantity twice as big
example: The city saw a twofold increase in the number of tourists over the summer.

source_translation: present as the strongest or main element
example: Agriculture remained the predominant sector of the economy during this period.

source_translation: to be the components or parts that form a whole
example: Nitrogen constitutes approximately 78% of the Earth's atmosphere.

source_translation: a very large group of people or things within a larger group
example: The vast majority of students (85%) preferred online learning over traditional methods.

target_translation: phần lớn nhất / phần lớn trọng yếu
source_translation: the largest part or most of something
example: In 2010, the lion's share of the budget was allocated to healthcare.

source_translation: the first step in a multi-step process or cycle
example: At the initial stage of production, raw materials are sorted by quality.

target_translation: bước tiếp theo / bước sau đó
source_translation: a step coming after something else in time or order
example: In the subsequent step, the mixture is heated to a temperature of 100°C.

source_translation: to experience something, especially a change or a process
example: The raw cocoa beans undergo a process of fermentation and drying.

target_translation: biến đổi thành / chuyển hóa thành
source_translation: to be changed completely in form or appearance
example: The recycled plastic is then transformed into small pellets for manufacturing.

target_translation: nhờ đó mà / bằng cách đó
source_translation: by which or through which; used to describe a mechanism or process
example: The factory uses a system whereby waste water is filtered and reused.

source_translation: to consist of; to be made up of
example: The manufacturing cycle comprises five distinct stages.

target_translation: kết thúc bằng / dẫn đến kết quả cuối cùng là
source_translation: to reach a final result or the highest point of development
example: The production line culminates in the packaging of the finished goods.

source_translation: used to show a very obvious and clear difference between two things
example: The consumption of beef was high, in stark contrast to the figures for poultry.

source_translation: very small in amount or effect
example: There was only a marginal improvement in energy efficiency over the decade.

source_translation: a person or thing that has the same position or function as another in a different place/group
example: Female students scored higher on the test than their male counterparts.

source_translation: exactly the same, or very similar
example: The percentages for food and housing expenditure were almost identical at 25%.

source_translation: to move faster than and go past someone or something; to be greater in amount
example: Demand for new housing has quickly outstripped the available supply.

target_translation: sự khác biệt / sự phân tách
source_translation: a situation in which two things become different or move in different directions
example: There was a significant divergence between the two groups after 2005.

source_translation: to reach a level where no further increase or decrease is seen
example: The number of visitors plateaued at around 2 million per year.

source_translation: important and deserving attention, because of being very good or interesting
example: A notable exception to this trend was the United Kingdom, where rates fell.

target_translation: trong khi đó (dùng để so sánh)
source_translation: compared with the fact that; used to show contrast within a single sentence
example: The city has 10 parks, whereas the neighboring town has only one.

source_translation: a small part or amount of something
example: Online shopping accounted for only a fraction of total retail sales in 2000.

source_translation: to pull or knock down a building
example: The old warehouse was demolished to make way for a new shopping mall.

source_translation: to adapt something to modern needs or habits, typically by installing modern equipment
example: The infrastructure of the city was modernized between 2000 and 2010.

source_translation: used to show that something is almost, but not completely, accurate or exact
example: Approximately two-thirds of the population lived in urban areas by 2015.

source_translation: an area where people live, as opposed to where they work or shop
example: The industrial zone was converted into a residential area with several apartment blocks.

source_translation: slightly less than a specific amount or number
example: The percentage of car owners in the city was just under 40%.

target_translation: xây dựng lại / tái cấu trúc
source_translation: to build something again after it has been damaged or destroyed
example: The local hospital was reconstructed and expanded to include a new wing.

source_translation: the majority or largest part of something
example: The bulk of the city's revenue comes from tourism.

source_translation: to move to a different place
example: The factory was relocated from the town center to the outskirts of the city.

source_translation: used to describe a percentage usually higher than 70-80%
example: A vast majority of the land was used for agricultural purposes in 1980.

source_translation: to reduce something by 50% or divide it into two equal parts
example: The number of people using public transport halved over the five-year period.

target_translation: điều ngược lại thì đúng với
source_translation: used to introduce a situation that is the exact opposite of the one just mentioned
example: While tea consumption rose sharply, the reverse was true for coffee.

target_translation: còn xa mới bằng / khác xa với
source_translation: very different from something or someone
example: The 5% growth in 2020 was a far cry from the 25% surge seen in the previous year.

target_translation: làm cho trở nên nhỏ bé (khi so sánh)
source_translation: to cause something to seem small or insignificant in comparison
example: The budget for education was dwarfed by the massive spending on defense.

source_translation: to be very similar to something else or happen at the same time
example: The rise in car ownership paralleled the decline in bicycle use.

source_translation: by a large amount or distance
example: Europe remained the most popular destination by a wide margin.

source_translation: to become much more important or higher in number than something else
example: By the end of the period, solar energy had eclipsed all other renewable sources.

target_translation: cuộc đua ngang tài ngang sức
source_translation: a situation where two competitors are very close and it is difficult to see who will win
example: It was a neck-and-neck race between the two brands for market dominance.

term: at the opposite end of the spectrum
ipa: /æt ðə ˈɑːpəzɪt end əv ðə ˈspektrəm/
target_translation: ở phía ngược lại của biểu đồ/phạm vi
source_translation: used to describe a person or thing that is as different as possible from another
example: While Sweden had high recycling rates, Greece was at the opposite end of the spectrum.

target_translation: mờ nhạt / chẳng thấm tháp gì khi so với
source_translation: to seem much less important, serious, or good when compared with something else
example: The 2% increase in wages pales in comparison to the 10% rise in inflation.

source_translation: a lack of compatibility or similarity between two or more facts
example: The discrepancy between the two sets of figures suggests an error in data collection.
